customer_reviews.title: Skip this ThinkPad
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our business and all I can say is that ThinkPad is not really up to the standards of the ThinkPad line. I have owned every ThinkPad since the T20 and still have working T40p and a T61p. Gone are most of the things that made this a great laptop. The build quality is mediocre and the trackpad is shot, and the keyboard...well that is destroyed as well. Skip this as a purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Worst trackpad ever
customer_reviews.text: If you are getting this laptop for personal use, beware. Do your homework and test out the laptop in a store before you pump your $$$ into this horrible machine. The specs are fine, keyboard is great and display is hands down awesomeness. All of this just evaporates when you get started with the track pad. Absolute worst experience trying to scroll / right click or even just click on stuff. There is just one square and it will frustrate the heck out of you when you try to get things done!! Stay very far away from this one and get other models which have better trackpads.
customer_reviews.author: V. Chilakamarri

customer_reviews.title: An Ergonomic Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: It's very sad -- I have sworn by ThinkPads for fifteen years, but with the new 540 series, I've been forced to go elsewhere. The change in the keyboard/trackpad configuration makes the 540 nigh-impossible to use comfortably. They've gotten rid of the independent buttons for mouse pointer and trackpad, both, instead forcing users to click, HARD, on the trackpad itself even if they're using the pointer mouse on the keyboard. That, combined with the fact that they've moved the trackpad away from the center and into a weird, uncomfortable location on the left, makes the 540 series very, very difficult to use without plugging in an external mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Tod Gemuese

customer_reviews.title: Solid, fast, but bad trackpad and keyboard
customer_reviews.text: i have had 4 IBM (now Lenovo) laptops and another 5 or so of other brands. Pro All my lenovos have been reliable, this one probably too. The startup of this laptop is much better than the w520 due to solid state disk. Con The w520 had a great keyboard, this has a terrible one, with reorganized keys for extra confusion. Beyond terrible trackpad, you need to use it with a mouse. Too much finger resistance and too much force required to click. Real productivity killer. No charging LEDs. This means you do not know if it is actually charging unless you start it up. This is a real pain in hotels in the developing world.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V

customer_reviews.title: Lenovo has LOST THEIR WAY!
customer_reviews.text: I waited 2 months for this from the Lenovo factory. Keyboard was the worst ever. Keys actually stick arounf the red nav nub. Keys made screaching noise and were not smooth. One thing Thinkpads were know for was the best keyboard, not any more. All indicator lights are gone. I returned this POS within days as it could hardly even boot with itu errors and would not shut down right out of the box! Lenovo has lost their way!
customer_reviews.author: Greg in Jax FL

customer_reviews.title: not the best, but will suffice
customer_reviews.text: Touchpad blues. I've had a T49, T500, W520, and now a new and "improved" W540. This is the first time ever I've regretted an upgrade. My laptop is a critical tool for my work. It needs to function properly. The touchpad just doesn't work. One can loose a spreadsheet in a split second. The touch pad is a no go. OK, my solution is a wireless mouse... not the best, but will suffice. It's a shame. I really hope they fix this with future models. If not, this is my last Thinkpad.
customer_reviews.author: Br. Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Complete, utter garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst trackpad you'll ever use. Having using a 15" MacBook Pro before this machine, I've been to the mountaintop, and this ain't it. The entire button depresses, and it depresses so much that you'll get tracking errors. The "MultiTouch" features built in are nearly useless as well, due to all the tracking errors, ignored input, and poor surface texture. This is probably also the thickest, heaviest, flimsiest "mobile workstation" your boss will ever buy for the poor non-management types who don't rate a decent laptop. The build quality on this machine is nearly the worst I've ever seen (almost as bad as an HP ProBook!). If your IT department starts rolling these out... I'm sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan
